Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery oinochoe; interior of neck glazed, reserved below; exterior: upper part pf neck glazed with frieze of interlinked pendent buds (with dots in interstices) below, between bands; panel below framed by vertical strip of linked double dots between pairs of lines; in panel, Herakles (back of head with probable lion's skin, mane with added red, club raised aggressively in left hand, upper part of quiver with added white dots on top and with bow attached remaining) moving right; accidental smear of glaze over club and quiver.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the ornament, see the pelike, Oxford 563 (ABV, 396, no. 21; Boardman, J., Athenian Black Figure Vases. London, 1974, fig. 229 attributed to the Eucharides Painter).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 312, no. B327)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0319) (Phase 1)
